Posts.Content: Hi I have applied for PIP and have my assessment soon but am not sure what to expect.  Does anyone have any experience of this? Thanks Vx
Posts.Title: Does anyone know anything about PIP?

Posts.Content: Thank you Taralou....this is what I have been hearing too!   I am sure there must be a better way for this process to be achieved. It is pathetic to think results are based on making people live their worst day when doctors already provide the information. I will have my sister here when/if the agree to a home visit.    Thank you for your help and good luck if you apply too. Vx
Posts.Title: Does anyone know anything about PIP?

Posts.Content: You bet I will....already too exhausted to even try to look good every day....it will be like Halloween though...hope they can cope! Again...thank you. Vx
Posts.Title: Does anyone know anything about PIP?

Posts.Content: Thank you Judith....I am looking at these just now and loving the info from Dayityrose that she has given.  I really appreciate your efforts for me. Kind regards Vx
Posts.Title: Does anyone know anything about PIP?

Posts.Content: Thank you Lesley, I am having a look now....the link is a great help! Kind regards Vx
Posts.Title: Does anyone know anything about PIP?

Posts.Content: Hi Dayity You are brilliant thank you.   I really have needed this kind of help and it is massively helpful.   I have already cancelled the assessment since they wanted me to do a 45 min journey etc and I am just not up to that but I have requested a home visit instead.  Don't have a new date yet but at least it gives me time to breath! Thank you for the time you have taken to help me. Kind regards. Vx
